summary: This is a July 2, 2020 press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and with perjury related to 2016 depositions. The document outlines the alleged grooming and abuse scheme spanning from 1994 to 1997 across multiple locations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and with perjury for false statements in 2016 depositions. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier alleged to have conspired with Ghislaine Maxwell to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14 between 1994 and 1997.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement condemning Maxwell's alleged role in facilitating and participating in the sexual abuse of minors.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the New York Field Office of the FBI
persons.context: Made a statement praising the bravery of the victims and condemning Maxwell and Epstein's actions.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement commending investigators and law enforcement partners for their commitment to justice for survivors of sexual assault.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated, aided, and participated in Epstein's sexual abuse of minor victims, delivering them to him.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and a federal indictment was unsealed charging her with conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors and with perjury.

events.title: Alleged Abuse Conspiracy Period
events.description: The period during which Maxwell and Epstein are alleged to have conspired to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell allegedly made several false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors.
The indictment alleges the abuse scheme operated from at least 1994 to 1997, targeting girls as young as 14.
Maxwell is charged with perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions related to the case.
The alleged grooming and abuse occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London.
The press release includes statements from top law enforcement officials praising the victims' bravery and condemning the crimes.
